description.p: A tall human figure strides through the dimly lit temple, clad in tattered robes and bearing a whip. His eyes gleam with fervent devotion as he approaches the altar, ready to enact the will of Haldir upon his own flesh.

A human, her body adorned with ritual scars, kneels before the shrine, her face a mask of solemn determination. With each lash of the whip, she offers penance for her sins, seeking absolution in the ecstasy of pain.

Frothing at the mouth, a dwarf clad in chains beats his chest in a fervent display of devotion, his chants echoing through the sacred halls. With each strike, he seeks to cleanse his soul of impurity and draw closer to the divine.

These flagellants, diverse as they may be, are bound by their unwavering dedication: a relentless pursuit of spiritual enlightenment through self-inflicted suffering. Their devotion is not a mere act of worship, but a profound communion with the divine, a path to transcendence through agony.

For some, their fervor stems from a deep-seated belief in the cleansing power of pain. Others embrace suffering as a means of atonement for past transgressions. Yet, for all flagellants, their faith is a beacon of light in the darkness, guiding them through the trials of mortal existence.

People of civilized lands may recoil at the sight of self-flagellation, viewing it as a barbaric practice born of ignorance and superstition. But to a follower of Haldir, it is a sacred rite, a testament to their unwavering devotion to the divine will. In the hallowed halls of their temples, flagellants seek to purify their souls through acts of penance, striving to attain spiritual enlightenment through the crucible of suffering.

Flagellants find solace in the ecstasy of pain, embracing each lash of the whip as a divine blessing. Through their suffering, they seek to transcend the limitations of the mortal flesh, drawing closer to the divine perfection embodied by Haldir himself.

Not every worshipper of Haldir chooses the path of the flagellant. Some may serve as priests or clerics, guiding their flocks in matters of faith and doctrine. Yet, for those who walk the path of the penitent, self-flagellation is not merely a religious practice, but a way of life.

In the sacred precincts of their temples, flagellants devote themselves wholeheartedly to the service of Haldir, forsaking worldly pleasures in pursuit of spiritual enlightenment. They eschew comfort and luxury, embracing hardship and suffering as the truest expressions of their devotion.

When creating a flagellant character, consider the depth of your character's faith and their commitment to the path of the penitent. Discuss with your DM the origins of your flagellant's devotion and the role they play in the world.

What led you to embrace the path of the flagellant? Were you drawn to the divine teachings of Haldir from a young age, or did you come to the faith later in life? Have you always been a devout follower, or did some life-changing event spur you to seek redemption through self-flagellation?

You can quickly create a flagellant by following these suggestions. First, prioritize Constitution as your highest ability score, followed by Strength. Second, consider choosing the acolyte or hermit background to reflect your character's religious upbringing or solitary devotion.
As a barbarian, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 12 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d12 (or 7) + your Constitution modifier per flagellant level after 1st
Skills: Choose two from Athletics, Insight, Intimidation, Perception and Religion

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

tr.td: Rapturous, Blessing of Martyrdom, Instruments of Devotion

sheet.description: A fierce warrior of primitive background who can enter a battle rage.

setters.set: A fierce sinner of Haldir who can enter a battle rapturous.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, your zealotry and fanaticism change fear into a frenetic state. Whenever you fail a saving throw against the charmed or frightened condition, you don't become frightened. Instead, you enter in a rapturous state, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: You start to add your suffering die to your attack rolls.
Your movement speed increases in 10 feet.
All attack rolls against you are made at advantage.

At the start of your turn, roll a d4. On a 1, you act normally. On a 2, you attack the closest enemy you can reach with your movement. On a 3, you attack the closest ally you can reach with your movement. On a 4, you attack yourself, instantly taking damage of your attack.

description.p: If you are able to cast spells, you can’t cast them or concentrate on them while rapturous.
Your rapturous lasts for 1 minute.

sheet.description: Add your suffering die to your attack rolls. Your movement speed increases in 10 feet.. All attack rolls against you are made at advantage. At the start of your turn, roll a d4. On a 1, you act normally. On a 2, you attack the closest enemy you can reach with your movement. On a 3, you attack the closest ally you can reach with your movement. On a 4, you attack yourself, instantly taking damage of your attack.
At 5th level, you can use action and enter a Rapturous state.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, whenever you take damage and are left with 0 hit points by a hostile creature, all allied creatures within 30 feet regain hit points equal to your Flagellant level. In addition, you don't fall unconscious or incapacitated while at 0 hit points. You still roll Death saving throws, but you can take your turns as normal. Moreover, you gain the following benefits while at 0 hit points:

ul.li: You have advantage on attack rolls you make.
Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws they make against your Flagellant class features.
Your movement speed increases in 10 feet.

description.p: In addition if you die, all hostile creatures in a 30 foot radius must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be stunned for one round, and all your allied creatures regain hit points equal to your Flagellant level.
Also at 1st level, you start to bear the true instruments of devotion: the whip that flails your own flesh, and the flesh upon the pain is delivered.
Hand-Fashioned Flail: Attacks with the whip or the flail can roll your suffering die instead of the normal damage for those attacks.
Sinner's Flesh: While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a shield, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Strength modifier + your Constitution modifier.

sheet.description: While you aren’t wearing armor or shield, your AC equals {{ac:unarmored defense barbarian}}. Also, you can roll your suffering die for damage rolls for whip and flail.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can lash the sinners to punish them for their transgressions. Whenever you hit a creature with a whip or flail, you can force that creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target starts to bleed. If you score a critical hit on an attack using a flail or whip, the creature automatically starts to bleed, without making a save.

A bleeding target takes necrotic damage at the end of each of its turns equal to a roll of your suffering die for 1 minute. The creature can also stop the bleeding if it or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check against your Suffering save DC (8 + Proficiency Modifier + Constitution Modifier), or regains at least 1 hit point.

In addition, when a bleeding creature makes an ability check or saving throw against your Flagellant features, it must roll your suffering die and reduce the total by the result. If you target a creature that is already bleeding, the amount of damage is not cumulative, and doing so only causes the duration of the bleeding to resets.

sheet.description: Whenever you hit a creature with a whip or flail, creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target starts to bleed. If you score a critical hit with a flail or whip, the creature automatically starts to bleed, without making a save. A bleeding target takes necrotic damage at the end of each of its turns equal to a roll of your suffering die for 1 minute. Your Suffering DC is 8 + Proficiency Modifier + Constitution Modifier.

description.p: Also at 2nd level, whenever you have half your maximum hit points or lower, you gain a bonus equal to your suffering die to your damage rolls. You only deal this additional damage once per turn.
In addition, you score critical hits on a 19-20 on the d20. At 9th level, If you are using a whip or flail, you score critical hit on a roll of 18-20 on the d20.

sheet.description: Whenever you have half your maximum hit points or lower, you gain a bonus equal to your suffering die to your damage rolls. You only deal this additional damage once per turn. Also you score critical hits on a 19-20. At 9th level, it becomes 18-20.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you can purge the foulness from your sacred flesh. You can spend one hit die during a short or a long rest to remove a disease from your body.

sheet.description: You can spend one hit die during a short or a long rest to remove a disease from your body.

description.p: Starting at 3rd Level, you commit yourself to a Flagellant's Path. Your path grants you features at the 3rd, 6th, and 14th Level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Starting at 5th level, you can use your action to enter in your Rapturous state even without a negative condition affecting you, lasting for 1 minute.

sheet.description: You can use your action to enter in your Rapturous state.

description.p: Starting at 5th level, your ability to deliver and endure pain grows further.

Initiate's Flail: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action with a whip or flail on your turn. In addition, your attacks with whips and flails count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
Lacerated Flash: While not wearing armor, you gain resistance to slashing damage.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn while using flail or whip. Also, your weapon attacks counts as magical. Lastly, while not wearing armor, you gain resistance to slashing damage.

description.p: At 7th level, the pain of the lash on your body is tender as a kiss of a lover. As a bonus action, you can lash yourself and roll a hit die. You regain hit points equal to the number rolled and the poisoned condition ends on you.

sheet.description: You can lash yourself and roll a hit die. You regain hit points equal to the number rolled and the poisoned condition ends on you.

description.p: At 7th level, you find comfort in pain. You can use your action and spend 1 hit die to remove one negative condition affecting you. If you are under the effect of Rapturous, that effect also ends.

sheet.description: You can spend 1 hit die to remove one negative condition affecting you. If you are under the effect of Rapturous, that effect also ends.

description.p: Starting at 9th level, you can add your suffering die to the result of your Death saving throws. If doing so increases your result to 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling 20 on the saving throw.

sheet.description: You can add your suffering die to the result of your Death saving throws. If result is 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling 20 on the saving throw.

Starting at 11th level, the suffering becomes a close friend. You gain the following benefits:
Suffering Flail: At 11th level, you deal additional damage equal to your suffering die to all your attacks with a whip or flail.
Scared Flesh: At 11th level, whenever you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to be reduced to 1 hit point instead. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, and regain your uses of this feature after a long rest.
<sheet action="Reaction" usage="{{implements of pain:usage}}/Long Rest> You deal additional damage equal to your suffering die to all your attacks with a whip or flail. Also, whenever you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to be reduced to 1 hit point instead.

description.p: At 13th level, while you are under half your maximum hit points, you gain an extra action on each of your turns. This action can only be used to take the attack (one weapon attack only), dash, or disengage actions.

sheet.description: While you are under half your maximum hit points, you gain an Extra Action on each of your turns. This Action can only be used to take the attack (one weapon attack only), dash, or disengage actions.

description.p: At 15th level, while you are below your hit point maximum, you deal additional damage equal to your suffering die on critical hits.

sheet.description: While you are below your hit point maximum, you deal additional damage equal to your suffering die on critical hits.

description.p: At 17th level, you are closer to the path of purification. You gain the following benefits:
Bloodthirsty Flail: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a flail or whip, you deal additional necrotic damage equal to your suffering die.
Scared Flesh: You gain resistance to slashing, piercing and bludgeoning damage. In addition, you become immune to necrotic damage.

sheet.description: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a flail or whip, you deal additional necrotic damage equal to your suffering die. Also you gain resistance to slashing, piercing and bludgeoning damage. In addition, you become immune to necrotic damage.

description.p: When you reach 20th level you are considered one of the chosen disciples and hallowed of your deity. Marked a champion, you may ask your deity for a Wish, once. You cannot use this boon to grant effects that oppose the deity or alignment of your choice. Your Constitution ability score increases by 2 to a maximum of 22.

sheet.description: You may ask your deity for a Wish, only for once. Also, your Constitution ability score increases by 2 to a maximum of 22.
